Articles.Content:
Hi.

I'd like to know what I should plan for when starting a base building project? I want to build a base on minmus... I have no idea where to begin... Right now I'm mainly clueless as to how I'm going to dock different base parts once I've managed to land them on minmus...

To give you an idea of where I am in the game, up to now I've sent multiple manned missions to the mun and to minmus, I've built a large space station in orbit of kerbin, I've sent an unmanned science probe to duna and I'm using the following mods : K.A.S., Mechjeb (which I'm using for orbital info only) and procedural fairings.

I direct you here for how to build a modular base. Also, with KAS you could just land each module individually then link them all together with the fuel line thing. Though I recommend Kethane to actually make your base useful.

The 1st thing to decide about the base is what it's purpose is. You don't have any resource-mining mods so about the only purposes you can have are Science! and roleplaying. With the latter, you can just plunk down whatever you want there and pretend it's doing something cool. With the latter, you should probably have a Mobile Lab although this is more roleplaying than necessary, too.

Having decided what the purpose is, you then need decide on what sort of functional module(s) you need to build to achieve that purpose. Then you need to decide what sort of supporting modules you need to support that function, such as crew quarters, rover barns, etc. Basically, just make a list of all the functions that need to be carried out. Once you've done this, you can start figuring out how to get these functional parts to the location. Maybe you can combine several functions into 1 module, maybe other functions need modules all to themselves. The size of modules is mostly limited by the size of the lifter you can build with the parts you've unlocked so far.

If your base will be multiple modules arriving separately, then you have to be pretty good at landing them close together. MJ is pretty good for this, at least on places without atmospheres. Some would say too good, tending to land things on top of other things, so probably you'll have to hover and move over somewhat at the end. But this is Minmus where there's no gravity so this is no big deal.

Once your stuff is on the ground, you have the question of whether to connect them physically or not, and if so, how. This is where a lot of folks have lots of problems because docking on the ground can be a real hassle. But you've got KAS so no problem there. Just get things close enough together and hook them up with pipes.

So, say you want a science base built around a Mobile Lab. The idea is you'll have little suborbital landers (NOT rovers) that go out to all the biomes, get samples, and come back, then all the data gets carried into the Mobile Lab. Between lander trips, the Mobile Lab will rearm the goos and bays on the landers. And rather than transmit the data (which wastes science points), you want the Mobile Lab to return to Kerbin.

So, first you need to add stuff to the Mobile Lab so it can land on Minmus, return to Kerbin, and then come down safely by parachute. That's 1 module. Then you need the landers that will go get the science, 1 module each. Then you need some fuel tanks to refuel the landers, for 1 or more modules. Then you need housing for the lander crews, 1 or more modules. And maybe a power module with lots of solar panels to run the whole thing, but that's just for show because each module will have enough power to run itself or it wouldn't be able to get to Minmus anyway. Plunk these down close enough together to connect with KAS, use KAS to refuel the landers between trips, and you've got your base.
